test-case.name: fn-concat-1
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 1 (for this function) from the FO specs.

test-case.name: fn-concat-2
test-case.response-string: xs:string("Thy old groans ring yet in my ancient ears.")
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 2 (for this function) from the FO specs.
test-case.test: fn:concat('Thy ', (), 'old ', "groans", "", ' ring', ' yet', ' in', ' my', ' ancient',' ears.')
test-case.result-string: xs:string("Thy old groans ring yet in my ancient ears.")

result.assert-string-value: Thy old groans ring yet in my ancient ears.

test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 3 (for this function) from the FO specs.

test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as per example 4 (for this function) from the FO specs.

test-case.name: fn-concat-5
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses only upper case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-concat-6
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses only lower case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-concat-7
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses both upper and lower case letters as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-concat-8
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses the empty string as part of argument Uses "fn:count" to avoid the empty file

test-case.name: fn-concat-9
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function that uses the "upper-case" function as part of argument

test-case.name: fn-concat-10
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument set to "*****"

test-case.name: fn-concat-11
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument that uses another concat function

test-case.name: fn-concat-12
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as an argument to the "fn:boolean" function

test-case.name: fn-concat-13
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as an argument to the "fn:string" function

test-case.name: fn-concat-14
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as an argument to the "fn:not" function

test-case.name: fn-concat-15
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument set to "%$",#@!"

test-case.name: fn-concat-16
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function with argument set to "concat","concat"

test-case.name: fn-concat-17
test-case.description: Evaluation of concat function as part of a boolean expression

test-case.name: fn-concat-18
test-case.description: Can't have a function item as an argument to concat

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat()`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat("a string")`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat("ab", "c") eq "abc"`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat("ab", "c") instance of xs:string`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat((), ()) instance of xs:string`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-6
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat((), ()) eq ""`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-7
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat('a', 'b', 'c', (), 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h', ' ', 'i', 'j', 'k l') eq "abcdefgh ijk l"`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-8
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat(1, 2, 3) eq "123"`.

test-case.name: K-ConcatFunc-9
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `concat(1, "2", 3) eq "123"`.

test-case.description: Invalid amount of arguments to fn:concat().

test-case.name: K2-ConcatFunc-2
test-case.description: Invalid amount of arguments to fn:concat().

test-case.name: K2-ConcatFunc-3
test-case.description: Invalid arguments to fn:concat().

test-case.name: cbcl-concat-001
test-case.description: test fn:boolean(fn:concat()) where concat returns empty string
